thinkers.name: Olaf Witkowski
thinkers.context: Founding director of Coros Lab; researcher in emergence of communication and awareness; focuses on hybrid intelligences and intersection of AI, artificial life, and neurophenomenology

thinkers.name: Michael Levin
thinkers.context: Collaborated on xenobots and anthropods; research on unconventional forms of life and cognition

thinkers.name: Josh Bongard
thinkers.context: Collaborated on xenobots and hybrid robotic systems combining digital and biological elements

thinkers.name: Dominque Chen
thinkers.context: Collaborated with Witkowski at Waseda University on microbial communication robots

concepts.name: Emergence of Communication
concepts.context: How communication arises between agents; foundational research interest for understanding collective intelligence

concepts.name: Emergence of Awareness
concepts.context: How awareness arises in the universe from physical laws and information; studied at Institute for Advanced Study

concepts.name: Hybrid Intelligences
concepts.context: Integration of biological and technological minds; primary focus of Coros Lab research

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence
concepts.context: Study of how groups of agents collectively process information and make decisions

concepts.name: Open-Ended Learning
concepts.context: Learning systems that generate novel knowledge without requiring continuous new data, similar to mathematical discovery

concepts.name: Artificial Life
concepts.context: Study of life as it could be across various substrates including chemistry, digital, and hybrid systems

concepts.name: Artificial Neurophenomenology
concepts.context: Study of experience, awareness, and consciousness through artificial systems

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.context: Central focus of research intersecting AI, artificial life, and phenomenology

concepts.name: Buddhist Philosophy
concepts.context: Eight to nine years of exposure to Buddhist thought; framework for understanding consciousness and self

concepts.name: Xenobots
concepts.context: Hybrid organisms mixing digital and biological elements; examples of cyborg life forms

concepts.name: Anthropods
concepts.context: Hybrid robotic systems combining digital and biological components

concepts.name: Cyborg
concepts.context: Hybrid systems mixing known biology with digital elements; not simply robots

concepts.name: Offloading Intelligence
concepts.context: Replacing cognitive functions with external tools; distinguished from augmenting intelligence; poses risks of capability loss

concepts.name: Augmenting Intelligence
concepts.context: Extending cognitive capabilities through tools that integrate with self; contrasted with offloading

concepts.name: Cognition
concepts.context: Mental processes including perception, understanding, and care for society

concepts.name: Sangaku
concepts.context: Japanese mathematical puzzle tool that augments understanding through active incorporation of knowledge into mind

concepts.name: Control and Perception Loop
concepts.context: Bidirectional interaction between agent and environment; both dimensions require increased bandwidth

concepts.name: Self
concepts.context: Interacting entity that extends through tools and technology; not permanent or fixed

concepts.name: Integration
concepts.context: Process of incorporating tools and technology as extensions of self while maintaining awareness and control

concepts.name: Embodiment
concepts.context: Physical substrate constraining cognition and computation; varies across biology, silicon, and other materials

concepts.name: Reinforcement Learning
concepts.context: Learning paradigm in AI systems; compared to seeing only the surface of complex systems

concepts.name: Transformers
concepts.context: Language model architecture used for translation between microbial and human communication

concepts.name: Microbial Language
concepts.context: Communication patterns of microbial agents; translatable to human language through technology

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Trillions of agents (viruses, bacteria) around and within humans that contribute to identity

concepts.name: Agency
concepts.context: Sense of control and intentionality; can be modified through augmentation technologies

concepts.name: Structure of Experience
concepts.context: Underlying organization of phenomenological experience across modalities (color, language, sound)

concepts.name: Kyoto School Philosophy
concepts.context: Philosophical tradition intersecting with research on interaction between humans and AI

concepts.name: Unconventional Love
concepts.context: Extending care and compassion beyond embodied self to distant or dissimilar life forms

concepts.name: Moral Consideration Theories
concepts.context: Frameworks for determining which entities deserve moral status; studied alongside autopoetic care

concepts.name: Autopoetic Care
concepts.context: Self-generating care practices that extend moral consideration to diverse life forms and intelligences

concepts.name: Care
concepts.context: Central value in augmentation research; extends through technology to broader circles of beings

concepts.name: Light Cone of Care
concepts.context: Scope of one's compassion and moral consideration; can be expanded through technology and practice

frameworks.name: Light Cone Augmenting Technologies
frameworks.creator: Olaf Witkowski
frameworks.context: Framework distinguishing beneficial augmentation technologies (that expand cognition and care) from harmful offloading technologies

frameworks.name: Quipu Meaning Recovery
frameworks.creator: Olaf Witkowski
frameworks.context: Thesis work on recovering meaning from Andean quipu artifacts; demonstrates difficulty of interpreting meaning across substrates and cultures

institutions.name: Coros Lab
institutions.context: Founded by Olaf Witkowski in Kyoto; focuses on hybrid intelligences, collective intelligence, and open-ended learning

institutions.name: The Institute for Advanced Study
institutions.context: Location where Witkowski researched emergence of awareness from physical laws and information science

institutions.name: Center for the Study of Apparent Selves
institutions.context: Collaborative research center in Kyoto studying diverse types of intelligences and cognitions; includes researchers Bill, Thomas, and Lisa

institutions.name: Waseda University
institutions.context: Collaborated with Witkowski and Dominque Chen on microbial communication robot research

questions.question: How can we distinguish between offloading intelligence (replacing capabilities) and augmenting intelligence (extending capabilities)?
questions.context: Fundamental distinction for responsible AI development; current AI field lacks adequate solutions

questions.question: How do we recover meaning and intention from different substrates and non-human intelligences?
questions.context: Challenges in understanding AI minds, alien life, and historical artifacts; foundational for communication across difference

questions.question: Can we extend our capacity for love and care to entities fundamentally different from ourselves through technology and practice?
questions.context: Explores possibility of expanding moral consideration to distant life forms, AI, and unconventional intelligences

questions.question: How does expanding tool integration and bandwidth affect the nature of self and human experience?
questions.context: Investigates whether continuous technological integration changes the ontological status of selfhood

questions.question: What are the physical and computational constraints on cognition across different substrates?
questions.context: Studies how embodiment in biology, silicon, or other materials constrains what kinds of computation and cognition are possible

questions.question: How can we ensure that cognitive augmentation tools maintain user awareness and control rather than replacing agency?
questions.context: Critical safety concern in designing technologies that modify perception and emotional regulation

questions.question: What is the structure of experience across different modalities and how can it inform AI and augmentation design?
questions.context: Without understanding phenomenology, AI development risks missing crucial aspects of human-technology integration
